list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: That newspaper story is bound to arouse interest.

list_definition.definition: a matter, activity etc that is of special concern to one

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Gardening is one of my main interests.

list_definition.definition: money paid in return for borrowing a usually large sum of money

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The (rate of) interest on this loan is eight per cent

list_definition.definition: (a share in the ownership of) a business firm etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He bought an interest in the nightclub.

list_definition.definition: a group of connected businesses which act together to their own advantage

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I suspect that the scheme will be opposed by the banking interest (= all the banks acting together).

list_definition.definition: to arouse the curiosity and attention of; to be of importance or concern to

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Political arguments don’t interest me at all.

list_definition.definition: (with in) to persuade to do, buy etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Can I interest you in (buying) this dictionary?

list_ex_of_english: The results, presenting both qualitative and quantitative analyses, provide interesting insights into the responses of the students to the experiment itself.
